content.description: The figures represent three metal spheres on insulating stands. Initially, Sphere <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is positively charged, and spheres <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> and <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> are uncharged. Spheres <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> and <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> are in contact when Sphere <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is brought near, but does not touch, Sphere <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi> </math>, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. Sphere <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> is then separated from Sphere <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. Finally, Sphere <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is moved far away (not shown).
